summary:
SophSys is a Dutch based technology provider for renewable/green energy.
Focussed on waste2energy, SophSys deploys turn-key solutions for converting household waste and Industrial waste to energy via a C3 chemical recycling pyrolysis system into energy for local and national grid systems
As the exclusive partner for Croatia and several oher countries, SophSys is a proud partner of Waste4Me.
The Waste4Me C3 Chemical Recycling Pyrolysis technology is seen as BAT (Best Available technology) in accordance with the EU directive for waste and waste management and is the only 24/7, multi-flow operated system in the world.

As COO of SophSys, Martijn Beerthuizen is responsabel for project development and interacts with local governments, waste companies and suppliers.
Alongside the responisbilies as the COO of SophSys, Martijn Beerthuizen teaches masters and bachelor students at Pryazovskyi State technical University Mariupol Ukraine.

profile_positions.description:
SophSys BV is a Dutch company that brings innovative green technology to the world. The company is focused on developing new technologies in renewable energy and bringing these to market.
Started as a specialist on fuel and emission reduction for combustion engines (www.cyclone-x.com  www.dfc2020.com  ), SophSys evolved into an energy storage en green energy production specialist, active in several countries worldwide.

Together with a team of experts on finance, subsidies and engineers, SophSys assists companies, industry, NGO’s and governments on implementing solutions for their renewable energy objectives and assists companies worldwide with competing in tender programs via its associated tender specialists.

SophSys is co-owner of a whole new engine-testing facility at Kharkiv State University for Railway Transport, which opens its doors to other developers to perform tests and conduct research at this testing facility.

profile_positions.description:
through my work in Ukraine on the new fuel enhancer DFC2020 I got connected to the Ukrainian State University of Railway Transport in Kharkiv. As part of my cooperation with the university, they asked me to teach their students on new technologies and developments. This University is considered to be the leading university in Ukraine on trains and train transport and the department of heat engineering is part of this great institute. As a guest lecturer at this department I teach the students on the latest developments and industry improvements and help them to get ready for the corporate world.

Teaching at this University is a challenge and also a privilege. Dealing with the differences in language en culture makes this an interesting job and it is fun to be different in the way of teaching. The university teaches knowledge from science where I apply the practical daily knowledge and experience from the field. This makes an interesting combination for teaching and as I like to experiment in the classroom, the students seem to like the different ways I take.

profile_positions.description:
As the President of one of Hollands largest dragracing organisations we intervened between the boyracers (illegal streetracers) and the dutch government by creating dragracing events for the youth. OSL Racing was a US Army/NHRA based dragracing programm aimed at preventing the GI's stationed in Germany from entering illegal streetraces outside of the base. Because of the straatracing problems in Holland and the knowledge available OSL Racing was send in to Holland to help put a stop to the dangerous races. 
As the president I handled Public Relations, event promotion and just about everything in between that's needed to host events for 800 to 80.000 people and handled at any given time between 20 and 60 staff, most of witch were volunteers.
